intro: Flaveria bidentis var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf flaveria, is a flowering plant in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it typically grows in dry, open habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It is an annual herb that often thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in ecological and taxonomic studies.
